item.title: A Brief Demonstration of the Markdown Markup Language
item.description:
Below (if you’re viewing the source of this document) is a demonstration of some of the Markdown syntax. If more fine-tuned control is required, the .markdown file containing the post can be renamed into a .html file, and the Markdown syntax will continue to work, as long as the YAML Front Matter (the content at the top of the document) remains intact.

Easily write a list of instructions:

Pedantic Lightbulb Replacement Instructions:

  1. Find the switch controlling the affected site and switch it off.
  2. Remove the destroyed bulb from its holder by unscrewing it in a series of counter-clockwise gentle rotations.
  3. Place a fresh bulb in the socket (reversing the movement used to remove the last bulb.)
  4. Reverse the instructions you followed after finding the switch in step 1.

A simple bulleted list.

  • Item A
  • Item B
  • Item C

A nested list structure:

  • Chess Trivia
    • Chess Pieces
      1. King
      2. Queen
      3. Bishop
      4. Knight
      5. Rook
      6. Pawn
    • Common Openings
      • Two Knights
      • Ruy Lopez
      • King’s Gambit
      • Caro-Kann
      • Sicilian Defense

Here’s a relative link to the root of the site followed by a referenced link to an external site.

Here’s one way to bold text and italicize text. An alternative way to emphasize text is using this syntax. These last couple of sentences have no line breaks due to the lack of a blank line between them.

Use ‘>’ to begin a blockquote element around the text which appears after. Leave a completely blank line to end the blockquote. To have text on multiple lines within a blockquote, simply use the <br> tag.

This text appears two lines down within the blockquote.

This text appears outside of the blockquote.

Three or more hyphens separated by two blank lines indicates a horizontal rule as seen above.

Headers are created by preprending a quantity of # symbols before the line of text to indicate the rank. 1 is the largest and 6 is the smallest.

Here’s the largest header

Here’s the smallest header

These can of course be styled via the .scss files as desired.

This is an image of Edinburgh Castle.

item.title: Welcome to ECE 123
item.description: Have a seat and we’ll get started soon!
